fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to be able to see past sprints information in the Sprint field like it was in Classic Projects.

Example:
*Next-Gen:*
!Image 2019-03-11 at 10.16.10 AM.png|thumbnail! 
*Classic*
 !Image 2019-03-11 at 10.16.51 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to be able to see past sprints information in the Sprint field

fields.description: As a user, I want to be able to choose which Epics will be displayed in the roadmap
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to choose which Epics will be displayed in the roadmap

fields.description:
When you have the *Backlog* feature enabled, if you open the board view and create a new issue, this issue will automatically move to the *Backlog* tab and it won't appear on your board.

As a Jira Software user, I would like that issues created inside the board view will stay in the board view, even with the *Backlog* feature enabled.
fields.summary: Next-gen Projects - Issues created inside the board view should not move to the board backlog.

fields.description:
Calendar with wrong date when starting.
when selecting, to start a sprint, when going to select the end date of the sprint, in the calendar it comes with the date of 1944, lol, attached photo.
fields.summary: Calendar with wrong date when starting.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the new issue view is enabled, the keyboard shortcuts  to quick-navigate to backlog / active-sprint do not work

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud
New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable the new issue view
# Access a classic Scrum board with an active sprint visible
# On the active sprint view, click on an issue card
# When the issue detail view (modal window) is open, press "1" in the keyboard to navigate to the board's backlog

h3. Expected Results

The board's backlog is loaded

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view. To do this, please follow the steps below:

# Click the user avatar on the bottom-left of the screen and click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view*, click the green button to disable the feature

This feature can only be disabled at the user level. Please ask all your users to follow the steps above
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts do not work in the active sprint view when the new issue view is enabled

fields.description:
In Jira classic boards it is possible to move multiple tickets from one column to another at once, as described in the video attached.

 [^Screen Recording 2019-02-25 at 09.37 PM.mov] 

As a Jira next-gen user, I want to be able to move multiple tickets from one column to another at once on next-gen boards, as it is possible in classic boards.
fields.summary: As a Jira next-gen user, I want to be able to move multiple tickets from one column to another at once

fields.description:
Currently, when the "Status" field is added to the card layout, it is displayed as a simple text. It is much harder to view the status at a glance this way. Also, in the backlog view, the card is displayed in double the depth.

As s Jira Software user, I want the cards in to add the status to the "normal," single-line compact card view of the backlog and have the status display in its normal-colored box
format.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want color field "Status" when added into board's Card Layout

fields.description:
Administration Users screen not working.

Page does not load, saying the following:

"Uh oh! Something went wrong.

We had trouble trying to fetch your users. Refresh the page to try again."
fields.summary: Administration Users screen not working

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*
Click on Lĺink to issue in comment mention in side notifications panel in nextgen project in board view opens old issue view in the same window as currently opened board. 

It results in navigation away from board. Navigating back using browsers back button do not restore scroll of board, do not open notifications sidebar and do not restore scroll in notification scrollbar

*How it should behave:*
Click on Lĺink to issue in comment mention should open modal with new issue view. So it will not break current state of application and user can easily continue to browse other notifications or continue work with board.

*Why it's bug*
I consider its major UX problem and should be fixed as bug because it significantly slowing down work with notification and it could be annoying for user.

It also behaves differently from clicking on issue link of assign notification because it opens new issue view but also in same window.
fields.summary: [BUG] Link to issue in comment mention in side notifications panel navigates to old issue view away from board in Next Gen project.

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*
 Link to issue in side notifications panel opens issue navigates away from board.

*How it should behave:*
 Link to issue in side notifications panel opens issue should open modal with issue view.

*Why it's bug*
It really breaks UX of notification and force user to navigate back to board after opening issue in the same window. Also scroll of board is not restored after navigating back from issue.
fields.summary: [BUG] Link to issue in side notifications panel opens issue navigates away from board in Next Gen project.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create a next-gen project (or use an existing one)
 * Change access to Limited
 * Access the next-gen board
 * Try to rank the issues as a user who is not an Administrator on the project

*Expected Result* 
* Issue is ranked as expected
* No error

*Actual Result* 
Issue is not ranked and error is displayed
!Screen Shot 2019-03-07 at 4.37.38 PM.png|width=230,height=118!
fields.summary: Error 'The ranking of your issue has failed. We are unable to rank your issue. Please try again later' when ranking issues on next-gen projects with Limited access

fields.description:
Currently, the assignee avatar filter is of fixed size, and once the team is at size 8 it starts to fold with a 'more' button.

the page itself has much more room and it would be so much easier to work with all the team members appearing in the filter.

I suggest making the filter grow and shrink dynamically according to the space on the page,

or at least set a configuration to the size of the filter

Here's the related [question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/is-there-a-way-to-change-the-size-of-the-assignee-avatar-filter/qaq-p/1023289#U1024435]
fields.summary: Dynamically change the size of the assignee avatar filter

fields.description:
As a Product Manager

I want to add Milestones to my Roadmap

So that I can visually communicate significant dates on my roadmap to stakeholders

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 # User can create milestone(s) against a roadmap.
 # User can give the milestone a name and description(and specify a date)
 # Milestones should appear as lines on the chart (similar to the way current date works).
 # The user can drag the milestone to different dates.
 # The user should see the name of a milestone is on the roadmap view.
 # User can add and remove milestones from the view using the filters above the main chart.
 # A user can select a milestone to edit or delete it.
fields.summary: Milestones for Roadmaps

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to be able to delete connected pages from my projects. Right now, if a page is connected to a Next-Gen project, it's not possible to simply remove the page. Instead, the only way to remove the page is to replace it with another one.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to delete connected pages from my projects

I was check everything, notification scheme and notify helper sad that user got all e-mails/

Help me pls
fields.summary: Have no notifications for some users
I unable to login in Android App, after change the login password from system, can any help on this issue? Thank you!

fields.description:
Independently of the repository that the branch was created, if the branch has the same name the count will not consider the branch ID and will display a wrong number of branches.

It would be good if the branch count use the branch ID to count instead of the branch name.
fields.summary: Branches with the same name are grouped in the count at the development panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 The flags for the issues in the new next-gen project disappear after refreshing the page.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud next-gen projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new next-gen project
 # In the backlog or the board create a new issue
 # Add flag to the issues
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The issue with the flag remains highlighted
h3. Actual Results 

The issue is still flagged when checked from the issue view while on the board its disappearing.
h3. Workaround (If there is no workaround directly say so) 

No workaround
fields.summary: Flags are disappearing in new next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Board reloads once drag and drop is done

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* The first time the user access an existing backlog with issues in any given browser; or clear his local storage manually;
OR
* User has to come via navigation or manually via url https://<INSTANCE NAME>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<BOARD ID>&useStoredSettings=true (which is the URL used by the navigation);

h3. Expected Results
Board is no reloaded

h3. Actual Results
The page reloads
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Classic backlog reloads once drag and drop is done

fields.description:
With the recent change in how the quick filters works, bringing them back to the page and not using the drop-down, the drop-down option is just unnecessary.

It would be great to fix the My Issues and Unassigned issues just like the other quick filters at the page and completely remove the button, the button misleads to click on it.
fields.summary: Remove the quick filter drop-down as it is no longer be used

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field and add to an appropriate request type.
# Create a Kanban Board and set to show the tickets from the JSD project.
# Raise the ticket at the customer portal and provide a value to the field added on step 1.

h3. Expected Results
The field value should be shown on the Board.

h3. Actual Results
The field is not shown on the Board.
 
h3. Notes
* If instead of raising the ticket via the customer portal, you raise via Jira interface then the field shows up.
* We were able to reproduce the error either by using a single text field or a Multi User picker.

* While accessing the issue via JIRA Service Desk we are able to see the field value successfully.
fields.summary: Custom field value for JIRA Service Desk it's not showing up, on Kanban Board(Jira Labs)

fields.description:
Please implement more list options for markdown in Jira Wiki-style rendered text fields, such as the issue Description field. For example, it would be great to be able to change the list type, especially for ordered lists as can be done with HTML, markup, etc., and to see this in Jira. Examples: * {{ordered list|type=lower-alpha       | ...       ...    }} * 
         
  1. ...
    2.       ...    
  Also, being able to continue a list item after sub-items, as in markup using a colon; formatting paragraphs, breaks, having multi-lined items, tables, multiple colums, etc. within the lists; using CSS to control other detault formatting, such as indentation, etc.   As it is now, in Jira, if we want to create an ordered list using lowercase letters, we have to use two hashtags, which renders in Jira as:     1.    1.            2.            3. ... And in a Jira macro on a Confluence page as:      1.    a.             b.             c. ... When what we were trying to create (in Jira and as displayed in Confluence) is:     a.     b.     c. ...
fields.summary: Allow more robust CSS in Jira mardown for creating ordered lists in Description

fields.description:
Exploring console logs, it appears that Jira Cloud uses some JavaScript functionality which will be disappearing in the next month.

Chrome Console has the following:

{{document.registerElement is deprecated and will be removed in M73, around March 2019. Please use window.customElements.define instead}}

M73 is the next expected release.

I'm not 100% sure of the impact this will have on Jira Cloud, but I thought for certain that it was worth bringing up
fields.summary: Jira Cloud at risk from Chrome 73 release

fields.description:
A few things:
 # Add a separate story-point counter to each Sprint's backlog view for blocked tickets so a user knows at a glance how many story points in their current sprint are blocked.  Currently the blocked story points are lumped together with the "In Progress" count.
 # Change the "blocked" color scheme from current (blue) to something else (red?).  This would apply to the Status dropdown option in each ticket, AND to the story-point counter for blocked tickets mentioned in item 1 above.

 

!image-2019-02-27-10-01-23-710.png!
fields.summary: Add "Blocked" story point counter to Backlog

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to set different fonts or background colors for custom fields on the board's card layout.

For example, the options in bold or color to stand out better in the board's card view a custom field's value, similarly to Epic' color.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to set different fonts or background colors for custom fields on the card layout

fields.description:
I'm trying to upload any image format and doesn't work.
 
!image-2019-02-26-11-06-11-181.png!
fields.summary: I cant attach any to Jira Software

fields.description: We find it a bit annoying the fact that when we put links in the issue's description or comments the link opens in the same window tab, so you have to either manually open it in a new tab or open and turn back if you want to go back to the Jira dashboard. I'd recommend placing/creating the links with the target="_blank" option.
fields.summary: Links to be opened in new tab

fields.description:
h3. Description

Right now, version report completed work % is influenced by any changes made in the Estimation during the release period. Once an estimation changes for a new value, that is higher than before, this new maximum value represents the 100% completed work even if it changes back to the previous lower value.

h3. Problem

If the new value is set back to a lower one, the report cannot reach 100% completion anymore, even if all issues are done.

1. Version report with all completed issues before any changes:
!Image 2019-02-26 at 10.42.05 AM.png|thumbnail! 
2. Version report with all completed issues change one estimation from 10 Story Points to 50:
!Image 2019-02-26 at 10.43.12 AM.png|thumbnail! 
3. Version report with all completed issues change the estimation from 50 Story Points back to 10:
!Image 2019-02-26 at 10.43.50 AM.png|thumbnail! 

*Please note that all issues in this version are completed but not released. However, even releasing the version, it does not update the information.*

h3. Suggestion

The 100% completion should be calculated based on the current total Story Points estimations and any changes should represent historical data only.
fields.summary: Version Report Completed Work

fields.description: When you need to change card layout on all of your 10 boards it is so uncomfortable to do it one by one. It would be great to have "bulk edit" analogue  for boards.
fields.summary: Edit multiple boards settings at once

fields.description:
For rather process control, we made field "fixes versions" required - so when preparing releases, we do not miss any task for developing or correcting an error. 

But, often, understanding for releases structure comes later, after preparing tasks...

As a result, we cannot save the newly formulated task until we create the necessary release on another browser tab. It would be convenient to be able to create a release for the current project right from the release field.
fields.summary: (For user with admin privileges) ability to fast create new release right from "fix versions" field on new issue form

fields.description:
In the new UI, I can convert issue types other than sub-tasks by clicking on the issue type icon, which is great.

However, in order to convert to a sub-task, I have to use the "See the old view" link to bring up the old UI. It would be nice to do this the same way as the others, or at least add the "Convert to sub-task" option on the new UI as well.

Ideally, we could do this from a Board as well.
fields.summary: New UI: Convert Story to Sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue. We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. 

Allowing teams to have required fields on issue creation is something that will be available in next-gen, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next 6 months. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively. In the short term we recommend teams use classic projects when you need to mark certain fields as mandatory on issue creation. 

We understand this is highly requested and seems like it should be quite basic to deliver, however we have some groundwork to undertake around the issue create experience which is a dependency for this work. We are prioritising the performance and scalability of the issue create experience as a first, and we will then get to overhauling the user experience of the global issue create view. We apologise for the inconvenience this is causing you.

It is worth calling out that it is possible to use the "Check an issue's field" [workflow rule|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/add-or-remove-workflow-rules-in-next-gen-projects-1005805110.html] to ensure a field is populated on transition of an issue (e.g. from "To Do" to "In Progress"). This may be sufficient for some of you, although it doesn't cater for the scenario where you need this data captured when the issue is first created.

Please do continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value with having required fields on issues. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
Eoin Ryan
Product Manager
{panel}


As a user, I'd like to be able to set fields and custom fields as required on my Next-Gen projects as it is possible in Classic Projects.
fields.summary: Ability to have Required fields in team-managed projects
When clicking on a story on the board when filtering by assignee nothing happens

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment there are only two system-defined sections in the Backlog 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow backlog to be split into user-defined sections

h3. Why this is important
It would enable users to sort tasks by using several sections e.g for a future version, design adjustment
fields.summary: Split Backlog Into User-defined Sections

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Kanban board is set to display images on the Card Layout, then all images that are contained within the filtered issues are also downloaded in the background.

h3. Impact
This causes performance issues on the browser if there are thousands of images on the board that are being fetched in the background.

h3. Mitigation for this problem:
Step 1) Restrict number of issues retrieved in the Board filter
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Step 2) Remove images from Card Layout
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: All images are downloaded from all issues on Kanban board if Card layout contains the 'images' field

fields.description: The Layout of the Dachboard is very limited in Design for the time. For Stand-ups it would be better if you are more free in Design of the Dashboards. Like size of the Gadgets.
fields.summary: Gadget size and Design on Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On the new issue view the Sprint field is blank when the sprint is completed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the sprint like on the old issue view
fields.summary: Display completed sprint on Sprint field while using the new layout

fields.description:
Yes, there is a way both in classic and next get projects to link issues with "blocked by" and "blocks" link types between issues in different projects, but that is very cumbersome to setup and therefore usually not being used (too much friction, steps to complete, switching between projects, etc). So, as a result various  workarounds are used. One example (that we are using in classic projects) is to have 2 boards for each project : 1 board is "traditional" and filters in only the issues fro that project and 2nd board is "cross team" board that filters in issues like this: 

*project = MYPRJ or labels = MYPRJ ORDER BY Rank ASC*

So, when other projects add a label to their issues that matches the project key of the project they depend on - their issue will show up on that "cross team" board. Very easy to use, but creates other problems as you can imagine, since this is technically a "hack" or workaround if you will.

So, the request here is to add a cross project issues dependencies functionality to next-gen projects that could combine the pros of traditional old school issue linking and the hacks/workaround as one described above and make it so it is easy to setup a scenario where an issue from one project depends on another project - either the same issue shared between both or a new one created in the other project and linked IN ONE STEP and from the same screen/page of the original issue that has a dependency. The key here is that it must be simple and accessible, therefore use case / acceptance criteria:
 # User John creates issue PRJA- in project PRJA
 # User John  opens details page for the issue PRJA-1
 # In that screen user John adds a dependency on the PRJB
 # Either creating issue PRJB-1 directly in PRJB, but without leaving the screen of PRJA-1
 # Or somehow specifying PRJB project key as dependency


 # When user Bob looks at the board of PRJB they either
 # see PRJB-1 created and linked to PRJA-1
 # or somehow see that PRJA and specifically PRJA-1 issue has a dependency on PRJB

 

As far as issue types - either story, task, bug or even a "special" issue type for such inter-dependencies - does not really matter as long as it is easy to setup without switching back and forth between screens of two projects/issues.
fields.summary: Cross Project Issues Dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to create Next-gen projects when the context for the field Flagged is not global
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restrict the context of Flagged field to some projects/issue types
 # Try creating a new Next-gen project

h3. Expected Results

The project is created
h3. Actual Results

The project creation fails
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Add a new context to the field that is available for all projects and all issue types
fields.summary: Unable to create Next-gen projects when the field Flagged is not global

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to configure a field as an optional or mandatory (required) field in the team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Please implement the ability to set a field as optional/behaviour in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.
fields.summary: Ability to customize field's behaviour in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description: 您好 我现在想要jira向另一个Jira只迁移用户 请问如何做到呢？
fields.summary: 不同版本jira迁移用户

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Days in Column presents a cumulative result of all days an issue have spent in a given status. This is the default behaviour of the application, but sometimes it's useful to know how many days have passed since the issue came back to a previous status and not the cumulative values for it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option in Kanban boards to reset the days on column values.
fields.summary: Days in Column from Kanban boards should have an option to be reset.

fields.description:
I know this is a controversial topic and I also realize a lot of people may not agree with me. However let's say,
 1. user A creates the label "Acceptancetest"
 2. User B accidentally types "acceptancetest" and picks this label thinking it's the "Acceptancetest" label.
 Result: Now we have 2 labels instead of one and the rest of the project members may also be confused. Also if we use search filters we may miss out on certain issues because of the labeling.

Maybe the standard could be that every project member is allowed to create labels. But I've found thread after thread where people ask for the same thing I'm asking for here. 
 Even though Atlassian has a certain idea when it comes to labeling issues. We, the users (many of us at least), seem to be using them in another way.
fields.summary: Add Project Permission - "Create new labels", so users don't create/use "wrong" labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For a DVCS integration, adding leading zeros (e.g. ABC-0000001) to the numeric value of the Jira issue key in a commit message does not update the Jira issue. Navigating to the URL (XXX.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-0000001) will redirect to (XXX.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-1) in Jira.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the issue key (ABC-0000001) in a commit message


h3. Expected Results
* The Jira issue (ABC-1) is updated with the commit message, just like how Jira redirects

h3. Actual Results
* The Jira issue (ABC-1) is not updated
fields.summary: Commits With Leading Zeros Added Do Not Update The Jira Issue

fields.description:
The only possible two options for the "default assignee" field (in project settings) are "project lead" and "unassigned". This is too less, especially for the low-level "Technical tasks" which of course should be auto-assigned, but not to "unassigned" or "project lead", but to issue.parent.assignee.

Technical tasks are often used to split the stories into technical steps/problems which have to be resolved on a technical level to complete the story. Having the technical tasks as a part of the stories enables the developers to plan the work, prepare better design, and track the progress more accurately and efficiently. This means that usually the default assignee of a technical task is just the story (parent issue) assignee, not the whole "project lead". In most cases the "project lead" doesn't have to know about all the technical tasks which are rather used by developers to better understand, document and track the story progress.
fields.summary: Assign "Technical tasks" to issue.parent.assignee

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
Some Epic issues cannot be searched when trying to "Add to Epic" to an Issue from the Issue view screen. 

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create greater than 50 Epic Issue from the Roadmap view e.g. 52 Epic Issues
 - Create other issues using other Issue types
-  Go to the Issue view Screen of an Issue e.g. https://your-domain.atlassian.net/browse/NGT-57
 - Try to "Add to Epic" from the ellipse icon(...), the first Epic Issue created 
-  Notice that the first two created Epics are omitted from the search.
{panel}

h3.*Expected Result*
* All Epics created should be searchable, just as it would on the "backlog" view

h3.*Actual Result*
* Epics which were created first gets omitted on the Issue view. Since it can only display 50 Epic Issues from Descending order (lastCreated to firstCreated). 
 !add-to-epic.png|thumbnail! 


h3.*Workaround*
* Use "Add to Epic" from the "Backlog" view will show all the Epics that has been created in the next-gen project.
fields.summary: Some Epic issues cannot be searched when using the Add to Epic from the issue view on next-gen projects

fields.description:
Currently a _Fix Version_ (or no version) must be chosen to run the report.
 This stops the report being available to the entire project.

Make the choice of version optional or add 'Any or None' as a choice.
fields.summary: Remove the need for a version when running the Time Tracking Report

fields.description:
As a user, there are cases where I need to structure user input as grids or tables (e.g. when creating a timeline during a postmortem or when working with tabular results data),

and I would expect that I could create a custom field of type "grid" or "table" which could be used to structure that data for consistency when working with my users.

This would help me eliminate data entry or formatting errors.

This would help me consume the data entered programmatically with fewer errors for analysis of my postmortem tickets or other similar data sets with fewer staff.
fields.summary: A Grid type for custom fields would help structure data for timelines, etc.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The information displayed in the development panel (branches, pull request and commits) of a Jira issue is updated with some delay 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Jira Software project (linked to a BitBucket Cloud repository) create a new issue (e.g. ABC-1)
 # In BItbucket Cloud create a branch having ABC-1 in the name
 # Go back to Jira and refresh the issue ABC-1

*Expected Results*
 The development panel shows the branch that we have created in step #2

*Actual Results*
 Nothing is displayed in the development panel and it will take some time (up to 30 minutes in some cases) before the new branch will appear in there.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment
fields.summary: Delay In Synchronization Between Jira And Bitbucket

fields.description:
It would be very useful if we could choose which fields to display on the story swimlanes of the "Active sprint" board.

Currently, only the type, id, status and summary are displayed.

I would like to be able to configure this, or at least have the possibility to add extra fields to these default fields (like we can configure extra fields for the cards in the "Card layout" board settings)

For example, I would like to display the assignee, the epic and the component.
fields.summary: Ability to configure fields to be displayed on story swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old issue view there's a *Show done epics* option to show/hide completed epics in the dropdown list, see the screenshot below:

However, there's no such option in the new issue view which causes completed/done epics to be appeared in the dropdown list:

This causes some concerns as users could select a done/completed epic mistakenly.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* New JIRA issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic and a regular issue
# Access the regular issue in new issue view
# Click on *Epic Link* field

h3. Expected Results
There is an option to hide/display done epics

h3. Actual Results
All epics (including done epics) are listed in the *Epic Link* field and there's no option to exclude or hide the completed epics.

h3. Workaround
For Classic projects, use JIRA's old issue view. You could disable "New Jira issue view for software projects" in your profile page so all the issues could appear in the old issue view.
fields.summary: Done/completed epics appears in "Epic Link" field in the new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue. We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. 

Given this suggestion is quite high voted we wanted to add an update. It isn't something we are currently working on it although it is something that we might introduce in the longer term. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams could find value with more granular permissions. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
 Eoin Ryan
 Product Manager
{panel}


h3. Summary

We would like the ability to control who has access to create/edit versions within a project. It appears the only way to currently do this is to grant the user project administrator permissions.

A way to control this in the permission schemes would work well.

I've seen the plug-in 'Version Manager for Jira' but this is for server only.

 

Cheers.
fields.summary: Add granular permissions relating to version control

fields.description:
h1. User Story

*As a user who has voted on a public Jira issue*, and is watching it because I'd like to know when it's released, 
*I would like to* not be spammed by endless +1 comments, 
*so that I can* get on with my life without wanting to throw my computer out the window.
h1. Details

When a user adds a comment to an issue which includes the characters "+1":
 # Email the user a link to documentation on JIRA's Issue Voting feature.
 # Delete the comment and add a single upvote.
 # If this user creates a "+1" comment ever again, then ban them from using any Atlassian product.
fields.summary: Comments including the characters "+1" should automatically by converted to an upvote

fields.description:
I have a project with more than 1.5k open issues. It is totally unusable in a new view because there are no Epic and Version Panel to narrow down number of issues displayed at once.

Component Panel would also be a nice addition.
fields.summary: Epic and Version Panel like in the old Backlog view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently on Next-gen Projects, the list of Epics on the Backlog view are sorted based on their IDs.

Meanwhile, Epics are sorted based on priority in the Roadmap view. Because of these 2 different factors, Epics on the Backlog view aren't sorted according to what is shown in the Roadmap which creates confusion.

h3. Roadmap

 !Next_gen_-_Roadmap_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Backlog

 !Next_gen_-_Agile_board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Match the sorting on the Backlog view with what is displayed on the Roadmap view which is based on priority.
fields.summary: Issue sorting on Backlog should match Roadmap sorting

fields.description:
We have a sprint in progress.....  in 

We have a Board to view it, not all items that in the Sprint appear in the Active Sprint view, but they are in the Backlog view.

We are using the following Board Filter

project = ZD AND Sprint in openSprints() AND Sprint not in futureSprints() ORDER BY Rank ASC

and the missing items are included in that filter.

If I go into Board settings and look at the columns I can see that the Status is mapped to a column and the settings page says there are nine issues in that status, but there are only 7 items in that column in the Active Sprint view.
fields.summary: Items not appearing in Active Sprint View that are in Backlog View for that Sprint

fields.description:
As a Scrum master i need ability to plan several rounds for feature, that are too complex for one sprint or need feedback from users.


Now there are 3 levels: *Epic* (for feature), *Story* (for one user type) and *sub-task* (*Tasks*, for development tasks). But if *Story* is quite complex there is a need to solve it in several sprints. But sub-tasks should be closed in one sprint, current sprint.

Now it is impossible to set the _Sprint attribute_ for sub-task - it is always inherited from the parent task.
The idea is to implement setup of the _Sprint attribute_ for sub-tasks in Story and process it on the _Active sprints_ board. 
So it would be possible to create one Story, add sub-tasks, solve them during the sprint A. After the end of the sprint, move the Story into the next sprint B, and add new sub-tasks for this sprint. 
Sub-tasks from sprint A will now be shown on the _Active Sprints_ board for the sprint B.

And also it would be more close to usual Scrum workflow, i guess: *Epics* (for multiple sprints) -> *Story* (for one sprint or for multiple sprints) -> *Task* (strictly for one sprint)
fields.summary: Improve Sub-tasks in Stories to work with different sprints

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Bringing Components into next-gen project/board is not something that we will be focusing on in the next year. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term we recommend teams use classic projects when you need to use Components. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you.

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value when using Components. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
 Bryan
 Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Customer is not able to add components to next-gen projects.
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to add components to next-gen projects.
h3. Why this is important

Customer willing to start using a next-gen project and want to add components.
fields.summary: Ability to create components to team-managed projects

fields.description:
*Issue screen from a dashboard*

My team is using JIRA primarily from the dashboard. When going to an issue from a dasboard gadget, I seem to land on and old view, the full screen issue detail view. I would love to have the new view, wich I configured to be 'stripped down', providing only necessary information. Is this a bug, or are you yet to roll out this function?

*Issue details in the JIRA mobile App*

As a site admin I seem to have no control over issue detail. It would be great if this would correspond with desktop configuration, meaning the new one screen fits all aproach.

*The problem being:*

I have a couple of *custom fields*, and they appear _waaay_ down in the list, buried in standard fields, wich we do not use. I would love to serve my team the 'only all you need to know' info.

Then again: *Big up!* the new one screen fits all aproach! If I really need a different screen in diffrent parts, it's my choice. Keeping al screens in the same fashion across JIRA was terrible, much better now!
fields.summary: New Issue Detail Screens

fields.description:
I searched, but could not find anything yet. If it‘s a duplicate, feel free to close.

 

Similar topic as here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33449 

 

Can we configure Next Gen projects, to show absolute timestamps, and not relative ones?

 

The “1 hour ago“ or “2 days ago“ make it pretty difficult, to i.e. copy paste into an email, compare to GIT.

 

Please advise, Klaus
fields.summary: Next Gen projects - Absolute timestamps

fields.description:
First of all, I know this is knit-picky, so please prioritize appropriately. =)

In [Get home, search or create with the global sidebar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Get+home%2C+search+or+create+with+the+global+sidebar] the contextual sidebar is referred to the "application sidebar" and in [Navigate projects with the sidebar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Navigate+projects+with+the+sidebar], it talks about the contextual sidebar being representative of the "application or project" level. However, under the image on that same page, it describes the contextual sidebar as containing information about either the "product" (instead of "application") or "project", which are differentiated by color.

Can you update the page so that those terms are consistent, please? I believe we're using "product" rather than "application" in this context, since the change in terms from Marketplace "add-ons" to "apps".
fields.summary: inconsistent terminology

fields.description:
How can I create a custom field that looks and behaves like this?  how do you do this?  Cannot find any documentation.

!image-2019-02-12-16-17-23-205.png!
fields.summary: Help me - how do I do this on own cloud instance?

fields.description:
Dear Servicedesk,

 

Since there will be a new view for issues it will be less convienent for me.

Because every time I open an issue I must click on 'Opmerkingen' (Comments) and switch to 'Zendesk Support'. 

Then also I have to click on Zendesk Support on the right menu to unvow the Zendesk Support information and Notify button.

In the old view it remembers my selection and opens the Zendesk support tab en unvow the Zendesk Support on the right everytime I open an issue.

Will there be such an option in the new view to remember the selected options in the issue?

 

Dear regards,

 

Henk-Jan Poortman

Dotweb Cloud Support

 

Screenshots:

 

New view:

!image-2019-02-12-14-08-00-557.png!

 

Old view (more convenient):

!file:///C:/Users/HENKJA~1/AppData/Local/Temp/SNAGHTML67917a51.PNG|width=1920,height=1010!
fields.summary: Zendesk Support in issues

fields.description: Similar to the functionality in classic projects, it would be extremely beneficial to have the ability to see the number of days an issue has been in a column.  I would like to see this displayed as a number of days on the agile board, rather than the 'series of dots' that the classic project display.
fields.summary: Next-gen projects - display in column

fields.description:
It would be nice if I could designate scrum masters for different project types, and then set notifications for those roles.

For example, I am the scrum master for my FSOPS projects, and I'd like to be notified (within product, no more emails!) when a new ticket is created in my project space, so I know to go take a look at it. I'm a small team, so it makes more sense for me to triage immediately when things come in.
fields.summary: Notifications for Scrum Masters

fields.description:
In company-managed (formerly classic) projects, when you resize your browser window the columns auto-adjusts their width, however, in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, it does not happen.

As a user, I'd like to resize my browser window and have the team-managed (formerly next-gen) board columns width adjusted as it adjusts on company-managed (formerly classic) Projects.
fields.summary: Make the team-managed (formerly next-gen) board columns auto-adjust their width as it is in company-managed (formerly classic) projects when resizing browser window

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

We have recently introduced the epic panel in next gen projects! With this capability, you can order your epics by dragging and dropping epics around in the panel. The same order will be reflected in your roadmap and board.

To learn more and/or provide feedback about the epic panel, read [our community post here.|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Improved-Backlog-planning-in-next-gen-with-the-epic-panel/ba-p/1387675]

We are closing this ticket. If you feel that this issue hasn't been fully addressed, please let us know!

Thank you, 
 Emily Chan
 Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
When changing the order of the epics in a next-gen project's roadmap, it would be great if the set dates to change too, depending to each other. Example:

Epic 1 - 1.2.2019 - 28.2.2019
 Epic 2 - 1.3.2019 - 31.3.2019
 Epic 3 - 1.4.2019 - 30.4.2019

If I change Epic 3 to position 2 in the roadmap and would like the dates to change:

Epic 1 - 1.2.2019 - 28.2.2019
 Epic 3 - 1.3.2019 - 31.3.2019
 Epic 2 - 1.4.2019 - 30.4.2019
fields.summary: In the new Next-gen project type, changing Epics order should "adjust" to their new position

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an inactive user tries to access the Manage boards page, some personal boards as listed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user and grant the Jira Software access.
 # Remove the site access of the user (deactivate).
 # Create a Scrum project
 # Edit the board and set the location to personal
 # Set the board's filter share to *Shared with logged-in users*
 # Login to Atlassian as the inactive user.
 # Access https://<site>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa

h3. Expected Results

No boards should be listed or the access should be denied.
h3. Actual Results

Some personal boards are listed.

!list.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The inactive user would not be able to access any of the boards listed.
h3. Workaround

Set the board's filter share to a specific project.
fields.summary: Inactive user is able to see some boards listed via the managed boards page.
Add Infinity Scroll to Website

fields.description: On Project settings > details on next-gen projects, we can only change Avatar, Name, Key, Category and Access. We also would like to have the ability to add the description of the project the same as we have on classic projects.
fields.summary: Ability to add a description on next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If you create an Epic Issue through JIRA + Create issue, all the fields you define for the issue creation screen will show up fine.

If on the other hand, you try to create an Epic in the Epic panel from inside an Agile board, only few fields will show up, and you will need to open the field configuration drop down to show the fields you need, changing the selection to All fields.

h3. Expected behaviour

Use the screen you've configured to create Epics in JIRA Agile as well, not a different screen.
fields.summary: Create Epic in JIRA Agile should use the same fields as JIRA

fields.description:
On next gen boards on Jira Software Cloud, issues which are moved to status 'DONE' are no longer visible on the kanban board after 14 days. I would like configure the time these issues remain visible (to be longer) or be able to disable the removal of removal of these issues. 

 

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  22nd June 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm pleased to announce that *we have shipped to everyone the ability to manually clear your DONE issues at any time*: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-manual-board-clearing-for-your-next-gen-Kanban-board/ba-p/1411958#M1379]

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  21st May 2020}
Hi everyone!

 

You'd be pleased to know that we have the feature *ready for rollout* to some customers for *early access!*

If you want to be the *first cohort of customers* to get this feature, please register here: [https://forms.gle/bv9HCdLbARfoXrLo6] 

 

Let me know if you got any further questions.

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
 

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  6th April 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm Ivan, a Product Manager in Jira Software, and I wanted to update everyone that my team is currently working on the ability to *manually clear issues in the DONE column on an ad-hoc basis.* Please be patient as we just wrapped up our discovery research and design spike, and will be undergoing development work in the next few sprints.

With regards to finding issues that have been cleared from your DONE column, you will be able to do that through the new ISSUE NAVIGATOR in next-gen as stated here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-issue-navigator-in-next-gen-projects/ba-p/1339049], which *will ship before manual board clearing*.

Regarding *bringing already-cleared issues back to the board* (which we don't encourage as it might be better to create a new issue instead reflecting the latest thinking about that work), you can simply change the status of the issue.

Let me know if you got any further questions.

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
fields.summary: NEXT GEN - Enable/disable/config removal of issues in DONE column

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to configure swimlanes on next-gen boards, as it is possible to configure in Jira Software classic projects.

This feature helps to distinguish tasks of different categories, such as workstreams, users, application areas, etc.
fields.summary: Custom swimlanes on team-managed projects

fields.description:
To align and plan multiple levels of work and private life, to see deadlines. To get an understanding for when I have to/can do that work. To be proactive rather than reactive. To have control and to be productive.
This is what you should do: create a project calendar feed URL containing start and/or due date issues.
I think that there is no need for a fancy full synchronisation feature where you can edit dates from the calendar application. In other words: all changes happen in JIRA. But relevant dates can be seen in the calendar.
fields.summary: Ability to have a calendar on next-gen projects

fields.description: reading several pages of help for the product does not understand well what the collaction to use on microsoft sql server to have full support of the Italian language. could you please answer me here and as soon as you can clear your internet guides in a clearer and simpler way? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: how install microsoft sql server for Jira server ?

fields.description: It would be great if we could block developers to open/create pull requests and branches from specific status in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to block creating Branches and Pull requests

fields.description:
Backlog tab is missing due to having 2 Kanban backlog column in the configuration:
 !image-2019-02-07-20-17-11-804.png!

 

Workaround:
- Create a new board with the available columns and use the same project filter to reflect on the new board
fields.summary: Backlog tab missing due to having 2 Kanban backlog column

fields.description: Perhaps this is more of a Portfolio suggestion, but as an Agile Product Owner, I would like to have the ability to add issues directly to Initiatives or other issue types defined as having child issues. This should operate similar to the way Epics operate today, with a + link that adds issues directly to the current epic.
fields.summary: Add the ability to directly create child issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the JQL query "*development[commits].all > 0*" returns issue without commits
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to search & filters > Advanced search
 # Enter the query: _development[commits].all > 0_

h3. Expected Results
 # Returns issues with commits

h3. Actual Results
 # Returns issue with and without commits

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: JQL Query For Issues With Commits Returns Issues With No Commits

fields.description:
When you enable the Kanban backlog feature, all your backlog items are moved from your Kanban board to your Kanban backlog.

For some use cases, customers would like to keep tracking their backlog items on their board view.

Please improve the feature and let the board administrator customize under board settings if the board backlog should be removed or not while enabling the Kanban backlog.
fields.summary: Improve Kanban backlog feature.

fields.description: We use a lot of issue filter results widgets on our dashboards. They rely jql filters using the currentSprints(), futureSprints(), closedSprints() methods. It would be awesome if a "sprint selector" widget existed that let you choose a sprint and it affected all of the issue filter results widgets on its dashboard. The selector could default to the current sprint. This would allow the product owners to view the dashboards we use for a future sprint or for a previous sprint. The jql could get a selectedSprint() method that is powered by this selector. This would save us from extracting a lot of Jira data into one of our data viz tools (tableau).
fields.summary: dashboard sprint selector widget

fields.description:
Display the (Inactive) flag on inactive users listed under an Epic linked issues. Issues that are part of an epic will be listed under the Epic with the ticket key, summary, issue type icon, status and the assignee of the ticket.

 !image-2019-02-04-12-59-23-441.png|thumbnail! 

When a user is inactive, it will display with the (Inactive) flag on all places within Jira, assignee, reporter fields and comments within an issue view, same for user fields on the results of a search on the issue navigator, but when the user is displayed under the Epic linked issues, this flag is not shown.

 !image-2019-02-04-12-59-49-075.png|thumbnail! 

To maintain consistency of information across the application, it would be good if the Epic linked issues gadget would also show the (Inactive) flag after the user's full name.
fields.summary: Display the (Inactive) flag on inactive users listed under an Epic linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Wallboards are not displaying content with the correct format. 
The columns don't have the right width. Wallboards are leaving some big black spaces and it's compressing the content inside the column. 
If you set your Dashboard to have only one column, the Wallboard will display a column with 300p width. 

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add some gadgets on it and change the layout for one, two or three columns

h3. Expected Results
The Gadget should display correctly on half of the screen or on the full screen
 !correct display.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results
This gadget gets narrowed down to a size that makes it unusable
 !incorrect layout.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
No workaround available
fields.summary: Wallboards displayed incorrectly (size scaled down)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Documentation on how to create a new board - [Creating a board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-a-board-764477949.html] doesn't include information on how to set a location and what that means.  There is some information regarding "location" sprinkled across several documents such as [What is a board?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/what-is-a-board-764477964.html], but it's not clear how to configure the location(and what the best location would be for a board), i.e. why choose to make a "personal board" over putting the board on a project.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add instructions on how to configure the location of the board on the "[Creating a board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-a-board-764477949.html]" page and provide information on what the location means for users who want to access that board(how can the board be accessed)?

h3. Why this is important
* It's not immediately clear where a board should be located, how to select a location and how that will affect users - will other users be able to see the newly created board?
 
h3. Workaround 
* n/a
fields.summary: Update "Creating a board" documentation to include information regarding "Location"

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, 

I would like to order the search query result by Team, 

such that I can quickly see how the issues are divided over the Teams working on the same project. 

 

The search results can be ordered by many different fields, but not by the field Team. Until the field Team was added which is shared with Portfolio, we used to have a custom field named ScrumTeam. This field could be used to order search results by. Now that we have moved from ScrumTeam to Team such that it links to our Portfolio plan, we lost the ability to order on Team. 

We use this often to get an overview of how the remaining items of a project/development worked on by multiple teams are spread over the teams.
fields.summary: Order search results by Team

fields.description:
As a product manager, I would like to have an overview about the completion status of epics in the backlog. The "Epics" panel in the classic backlog allowed to see progress information such as the count of issues (helpful for teams in Kanban or with noEstimate Scrum), count of completed and unestimated tickets and the total story point estimate. Also, there was a progress bar showing how many of the story points for tickets assigned to this epic were done. 

This was extremely helpful when prioritizing features across differen epics for the next sprint, as it allows to quickly grasp which of the running epics (we typically work on multiple epics within a sprint) can be finished. 

Finally, the ability to assign tickets to epics via drag and drop on the epic panel was one of the biggest time savers which is no longer available.

I am aware about being able to filter by epics on the "next gen" backlogs and also to assign via the "add to epic" function - but for me the UX here got clearly worse and I have to spend more time doing the same planning than before.
fields.summary: Next Gen: Create "Epic" panel in backlog

fields.description:
Hi,

I have different use cases when one of my teams need to add multiple values for the same field, but the number of instances will vary depending on a specific situation.

A common use case would be my QA using the "Scenario" fields within a User Story ticket to describe different testing scenarios related to that story. Please note that the number of scenarios will vary from story to story.

The way Jira is built right now I have to create fixed fields and include all of them in the ticket in order for them to be available to QA (i.e. "Scenario 1", "Scenario 2", "Scenario 3", "Scenario 4", etc.). This not only pollutes the screen but also limits QA from entering a higher number of scenarios then what the screen is offering.

Ideally, there should be an "Add Scenario" button available in the ticket for QA to click and add scenarios on an as-needed basis.

It would actually be nice to have the option to create all types of custom fields that very same way as a flag in their configuration, so when you add that to a screen it would automatically add the possibility to add more of the same on the fly.

Thanks,

Ricardo
fields.summary: Allow Users to add Fields on the Fly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
when duplicated filter names are created by an import or another function, the ViewSharedFilters.jspa  search is broken. 

h3. Environment

cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # import duplicate filters via import 
 # search for filter in ViewSharedFilters.jspa
h3. Expected Results
all filters should be returned 

h3. Actual Results
an error message states that no matching records can be found. 



h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available, please create a support ticket to investigate
fields.summary: duplicated filter names breaks ViewSharedFilters.jspa

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you configure a workflow trigger, and this workflow trigger is executed, JIRA sends notifications as anonymous.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud integrated with Bitbucket Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate a Bitbucket account with Jira
# Have an account in both Jira and Bitbucket using the same email address
# Create a classic project
# Add a workflow trigger like "Branch created" to one of the transitions, for example from "Open" to "In Progress"
# Create one ticket and move it to the "Open" status
# On the Bitbucket side, create a branch using the issue key created above as the branch name
# Check the email notification about the transition performed by the trigger 

h3. Expected Results

The notification (and issue history) says that the issue was transitioned by the user who created the Bitbucket branch

h3. Actual Results

The notification (and issue history) says that the issue was transitioned by an Anonymous user

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-31 at 3.16.27 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-01-31 at 3.08.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

No workarounds available at the moment
fields.summary: Workflow trigger notifications are being sent as anonymous

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The syntax used in the description field for Jira Desktop and the mobile app seems not to be aligned.
h3. Example - Desktop

If I type three hashes e.g. "### headline" in the description field, the result is a h3 headline:
h3. headline
h3. Example - iOS

If I type three hashes e.g. "### headline" in the description field, the result is a numbered list like this:
 #  
 ##  
 ### headline

h3. Expected behavior

Both, the desktop and the mobile syntax, are using the same markdown syntax. To keep backwards compatibility this could be an option in the settings of the mobile app.
fields.summary: Markdown syntax in Jira Cloud iOS

fields.description: Our software product dev teams use classic projects with Git integration enabled on Jira Cloud.  However, we're trying out next-gen projects for non-software-dev project teams, and the development panel is appearing in a context that is not helpful, and it adds to the visual clutter that tends to drive non-devs in our organization away from JIRA.  We'd like to have the ability to hide the development panel from select next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Show / Hide Development Panel on next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Switch to Bitbucket doesn't load the page correctly when using Firefox

h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Bitbucket Cloud
 * Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Jira to a Bitbucket Cloud account
 # Click on Switch to...  !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.54.36.png|thumbnail! 
 # Select Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket recognises the user session on browser

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket states the user doesn't have permission

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
* Try using Chrome
fields.summary: Switch to Bitbucket doesn't load the page correctly when using Firefox

fields.description:
When using sprints on Next-Gen project, the board name is changed and use the current active sprint name as board name, however, at the browser tab, the title still uses the old board name instead of being updated with the current name.

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, disable *Sprint* and you will be able to edit the board's name. This will reflect the board name displayed on the browser tab.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like that the browser Tab have the same Board name as my board

fields.description: When I select a renderer for a custom field, it opens the renderer for the field above it, rather than for it. i had to change my customer field to contain "A" before it so t showed at the top of the list to change the renderer.
fields.summary: Selecting renderers for custom fields opening the incorrect field

fields.description: Please introduce the ability to see the issue priority next to each issue item in a backlog list and displayed on the card of an issue in the kanban board. Without these views, issue priority is effectively useless in next gen projects.
fields.summary: Next-Gen Projects - Add Priority icon to JIRA Kanban cards and to Backlog list items

fields.description:
Currently, the fields specified in the Jira Software Cloud emails from notification schemes are very limited and not configurable.  This results in most notifications looking nearly identical, or needing to manually copy/paste the fields' data into the Summary field, for all tickets.  This takes a lot of time and introduces opportunity for errors.

I would like to add fields to the email.  Either the subject, or description, or from fields would be acceptable, but ideally, I would prefer to be able to edit the email format altogether, similar to other Jira products.

Other Jira installations allow adding fields through editing the Velocity templates, which would work for all types of notification emails that you may want to edit, not just the Create Issue notifications.  i.e. Issue Updated.  A ticket for making that process easier are under consideration. -- JRASERVER-7266

On Jira Software Cloud, we are unable to add any additional fields to the emails, easily or otherwise.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/how-do-I-add-a-field-to-the-email-notification-in-Jira-Cloud/qaq-p/281105]

 

Related Suggestions: 
 # JRACLOUD-62256
 # JRASERVER-62256
fields.summary: Adding Fields to Email Notifications

fields.description:
_*As a*_ Jira Cloud administrator 

_*I want*_ the ability to query Jira to show tickets whose sub-tasks do not have time logged against them

_*So that*_ I can easily identify all tickets which are completed, but do not have any time logged against them and notify the appropriate teams and/or users who need to go back and log their time

 

My company has recently begun mandatory time tracking for ALL new development work we do. This means all of our Jira tickets which are completed (not closed as illegitimate, etc.) should have time logged against them. If I want to verify that our developers are logging time appropriately, I can easily do an advanced search for tickets where "timespent is EMPTY". However, this query still shows stories which have sub-tasks where there is time logged against the sub-tasks but not logged against the story itself.  

 

Maybe I am mistaken, but I have not found a way to quickly identify stories which have no time logged against them AND have no time logged against their sub-tasks. I hope this is understandable. Please let me know if I can provide anymore info/context on this.
fields.summary: Ability to Find Stories Whose Sub-Tasks Do Not Have Time Logged Against Them

fields.description:
*Summary:*
 Users are not able to delete a sprint once the board has already been deleted. Those sprints are still queryable via JQL.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a Scrum board/project
 # Create a sprint ("Sprint A")
 # Delete the board
 # JQL on "Sprint A" or try to assign "Sprint A" to an issue.

*Expected Results:*
 JQL should not allow to query on orphaned sprints. Sprint field should also not allow to assign issues to an orphan sprint.

*Actual Results:*
 JQL allows to query on the orphaned sprint and the sprint field allows to assign an issue to an orphan sprint.

!orphan.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
 # Go to the *Backlog* of any *Jira Software Company-Managed* (Classic) scrum project.
 # The *Backlog* contains multiple swimlanes, the first ones are sprints swimlanes, the last one is the backlog swimlane.
 # Select an issue that is not associated with any sprint, an issue that is under the backlog swimlane.
 # Edit the issue sprint field and select the orphan sprint as your target sprint.
 # Now the orphan sprint is visible on the actual board, it should be a new swimlane inside the *Backlog* page.
 # Find the sprint you want to delete, and select ... > *Delete sprint*.
fields.summary: Unable to delete orphan sprint

fields.description: Tried to send feedback direct from Jira I get an error telling me something went wrong, probably the form is misconfigured.
fields.summary: feedback form is broken

fields.description: Why do I say downgraded, because I have lost 10% of my screen to a banner telling me about it, I dont care and I certainly dont need reminding on every page I open for months on end. There is no obvious way to permanently remove this. Whoever created this banner should be put against a wall and shot for disservice to humanity
fields.summary: Annoying banner... jira is downgraded to version 7.13
